definitions: To display a notice or sign in a public place.
To send a letter or parcel by mail.
To publish something on the internet, especially on a blog or social media.
To assign someone to a particular job or place, especially in the military or a diplomatic service.
To make an entry in an account book.
examples: She decided to post the announcement on the bulletin board.
He needs to post the letter before noon.
I will post an update on my blog later today.
The company will post him to the London office.
The accountant will post the transaction to the ledger.
